channel.title: Euler on Gautam Manohar
channel.description: Recent content in Euler on Gautam Manohar

item.title: Problem 1 - Multiples of 3 and 5
item.description: Problem Statement If we list all the natural numbers below 10 that are multiples of 3 or 5, we get 3, 5, 6 and 9. The sum of these multiples is 23. Find the sum of all the multiples of 3 or 5 below $n$. My Algorithm For the Project Euler problem, $n = 1000$. In general, the sum of the natural numbers up to $n$ is the $n$-th triangular number.
